alert.note: Alert for Covington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 9:32PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Covington. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 929 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing very heavy rain in northeastern Covington county in south central Alabama. 1 to 3 inches of rain has likely fallen with these storms and additional heavy rainfall may result in flooding of creeks and streams, local roadways, and urban and low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Opp, Wiggins, Eoda, Babbie, Horn Hill, Sanford, Blairs and Beulah. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
